poem:
Title: "Of Trials and Tribulations"

Wheels within wheels,
in the orange glare of morning;
Power, impeached — a field of cracked clay.

In Georgia, a cry for a 'fair' trial —
a demand, a demand.
Echoed in the House, mirrored in the Senate.

Lawyers like sparrows,
White-petaled misdirection.
Mayorkas, Mayorkas — the name lingers,
like a frost on the new day's grass.
